name: vscode-highlight
description: Advanced text highlighter based on regexes. Useful for todos, annotations etc.

highlight.decorations.description: Default decorations from which all others inherit from

isWholeLine.description:
Should the decoration be rendered also on the whitespace after the line text.
Defaults to `false`.

rangeBehavior.description:
Customize the growing behavior of the decoration when edits occur at the edges of the decoration's range.
Defaults to `DecorationRangeBehavior.OpenOpen`.

light.description: Represents theme specific rendering styles for a [text editor decoration](#TextEditorDecorationType).

gutterIconPath.description: An **absolute path** or an URI to an image to be rendered in the gutter.

gutterIconSize.description:
Specifies the size of the gutter icon.
Available values are 'auto', 'contain', 'cover' and any percentage value.
For further information: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/jj127316(v=vs.85).aspx

before.description: Defines the rendering options of the attachment that is inserted before the decorated text.

contentText.description: Defines a text content that is shown in the attachment. Either an icon or a text can be shown, but not both.

contentIconPath.description:
An **absolute path** or an URI to an image to be rendered in the attachment. Either an icon
or a text can be shown, but not both.

after.description: Defines the rendering options of the attachment that is inserted after the decorated text.

contentText.description: Defines a text content that is shown in the attachment. Either an icon or a text can be shown, but not both.

contentIconPath.description:
An **absolute path** or an URI to an image to be rendered in the attachment. Either an icon
or a text can be shown, but not both.

highlight.regexes.description: Object mapping regexes to an array of decorations to apply to the capturing groups

regexFlags.description: Flags used when building the regexes

filterLanguageRegex.description: Apply only if current file's language matches this regex. Requires double escaping

filterFileRegex.description: Apply only if the current file's path matches this regex. Requires double escaping
